info.description:
data.world's mission is to build the most meaningful, collaborative, and abundant data resource in the world, so that people who work with data can solve problems faster.  
In the context of that mission, this API ensures that our users are able to easily access data and manage their data projects regardless of system or tool preference.
info.title: data.world API

post.description: Easily create a dataset and add metadata and files at the same time via the API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:
User name and unique identifier of the creator of the dataset.
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), jonloyens is the unique identifier of the dataset.

403.description:
**FORBIDDEN**
The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.
For example, this error may occur you are not authorized to perform this operation.

404.description:
**NOT FOUND**
The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.
For example, this error may occur when the URL is invalid.

422.description:
**UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY**
The server understands the content type of the request entity and the syntax of the request entity is correct, but was unable to process the contained instructions.
For example, this error may occur if the JSON body of the request doesn't match the expected schema.

500.description:
**INTERNAL SERVER ERROR**
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:
User name and unique identifier of the creator of the dataset.
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), jonloyens is the unique identifier of the dataset.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Dataset unique identifier.  
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset is the unique identifier of the dataset.

examples.application/json:
{
  "owner": "sya",
  "id": "trumpworld",
  "title": "TrumpWorld",
  "description": "TrumpWorld Data",
  "summary": "From the Buzzfeed article [Help Us Map TrumpWorld](https://www.buzzfeed.com/johntemplon/help-us-map-trumpworld)\n>No American president has taken office with a giant network of businesses, investments, and corporate connections like that amassed by Donald J. Trump. His family and advisers have touched a staggering number of ventures, from a hotel in Azerbaijan to a poker company in Las Vegas.\n\n\nCheck out the data.world docs on how to Upload & sync files from [**Google Sheets**](https://docs.data.world/documentation/api/googleSync.html) and [**Github**](https://docs.data.world/documentation/api/githubSync.html)   \n\n\nSource: [github.com/BuzzFeedNews](https://github.com/BuzzFeedNews/trumpworld/tree/master/data)   \n\n_If you have suggestions for expanding or improving the dataset, please email trump@buzzfeed.com. If you’d like to send your tip securely and anonymously, see these [instructions](https://tips.buzzfeed.com/)._",
  "tags": [
    "trump",
    "trump world",
    "president",
    "connections",
    "swamp",
    "business network"
  ],
  "visibility": "OPEN",

403.description:
**FORBIDDEN**
The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.
For example, this error may occur you are not authorized to perform this operation.

404.description:
**NOT FOUND**
The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.
For example, this error may occur when the URL is invalid.

422.description:
**UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY**
The server understands the content type of the request entity and the syntax of the request entity is correct, but was unable to process the contained instructions.
For example, this error may occur if the JSON body of the request doesn't match the expected schema.

500.description:
**INTERNAL SERVER ERROR**
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

put.description: Create a dataset with a given id or completely rewrite the dataset, including any previously added files, if one already exists with the given id

parameters.name: owner

patch.description: Update an existing dataset. Note that we only update the elements or files included in the request. All omitted elements or files will remain untouched.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:

post.description: This method allows files published on the web to be added to a data.world dataset via their URL. The source URL will be stored so you can easily update your file anytime it changes via the *fetch latest* link on the [data.world](https://data.world/) dataset page or by triggering the GET:/sync endpoint.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:

delete.description: Delete one or more files from a dataset by their name, including files added via URL.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:
User name and unique identifier of the creator of the dataset.
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), jonloyens is the unique identifier of the dataset.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Names of files to be deleted. Multiple can be provided in a single request by repeating the query string parameter name as many times as necessary.

post.description:
Upload multiple files at once to a dataset via multipart request.
Swagger clients will limit this method of upload to one file at a time. Other HTTP clients capable of making multipart/form-data requests can be used to upload multiple files in a single request.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:
User name and unique identifier of the creator of the dataset.
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), jonloyens is the unique identifier of the dataset.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Dataset unique identifier.  
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset is the unique identifier of the dataset.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Multipart-encoded file contents

For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), jonloyens is the unique identifier of the dataset.

parameters.description:
Dataset unique identifier.  
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset is the unique identifier of the dataset.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: File name and unique identifier within dataset.

403.description:
**FORBIDDEN**
The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.
For example, this error may occur you are not authorized to perform this operation.

404.description:
**NOT FOUND**
The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.
For example, this error may occur when the URL is invalid.

413.description:
**PAYLOAD TOO LARGE**
The server is refusing to process a request because the request payload is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

422.description:
**UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY**
The server understands the content type of the request entity and the syntax of the request entity is correct, but was unable to process the contained instructions.
For example, this error may occur if the JSON body of the request doesn't match the expected schema.

500.description:
**INTERNAL SERVER ERROR**
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

get.description: Fetch datasets that the currently authenticated user has access to because he or she is a contributor.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to include in a page of results.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Token from previous result page to be used when requesting a subsequent page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Property name to sort by.
Prefix with `+` for ascending order or with `-` for descending order. For example, `-created` will return items sorted by the `created` property in descending order.

examples.application/json:
{
  "count": 2,
  "records": [
    {
      "owner": "bryonjacob",
      "id": "f-o-o",
      "title": "f-o-o",
      "description": "why do my datasets have to be at least 5 chars in length",
      "tags": [],
      "license": "CC-0",
      "visibility": "PRIVATE",
      "files": [
        {
          "name": "foo.csv",
          "sizeInBytes": 56,
          "created": "2016-06-09T21:56:06.943Z",
          "updated": "2016-06-09T21:56:06.943Z"
        }
      ],
      "status": "LOADED",
      "created": "2016-06-09T21:55:58.002Z",
      "updated": "2017-04-19T15:35:30.791Z"
    },
    {
      "owner": "eric-capps",
      "id": "zooblesnarb",
      "title": "zooblesnarb",
      "description": "test",
      "tags": [
        "bap"
      ],
      "visibility": "OPEN",
      "files": [],
      "created": "2016-11-02T21:18:58.696Z",
      "updated": "2016-11-11T16:56:30.714Z"
    }
  ],
  "next": "eyJyZXNvdXJjZSI6eyJzIjoiZGF0YXNldDplcmljLWNhcHBzL3pvb2JsZXNuYXJiIn0sInBhcnR5Ijp7InMiOiJhZ2VudDp1c2VyOCJ9fQ=="
}

tags.description: Dataset tags. Letters numbers and spaces only (max 25 characters).

license.description: Dataset license. Find additional info for allowed values [here](https://data.world/license-help).

visibility.description: Dataset visibility. `OPEN` if the dataset can be seen by any member of data.world. `PRIVATE` if the dataset can be seen by its owner and authorized collaborators.

files.description: Initial set of files. At dataset creation time, file uploads are not supported. However, this property can be used to add files via URL.

tags.description: Dataset tags. Letters numbers and spaces only (max 25 characters).

license.description: Dataset license. Find additional info for allowed values [here](https://data.world/license-help).

visibility.description: Dataset visibility. `OPEN` if the dataset can be seen by any member of data.world. `PRIVATE` if the dataset can be seen by its owner and authorized collaborators.

files.description: Updated set of files. At dataset update time, file uploads are not supported. However, this property can be used to add files via URL or update metadata related to existing files.

tags.description: Dataset tags. Letters numbers and spaces only (max 25 characters).

license.description: Dataset license. Find additional info for allowed values [here](https://data.world/license-help).

visibility.description: Dataset visibility. `OPEN` if the dataset can be seen by any member of data.world. `PRIVATE` if the dataset can be seen by its owner and authorized collaborators.

files.description: Initial set of files. At dataset creation time, file uploads are not supported. However, this property can be used to add files via URL.

owner.description: User name and unique identifier of the creator of the dataset.

tags.description: Dataset tags. Letters numbers and spaces only (max 25 characters).

license.description: Dataset license. Find additional info for allowed values [here](https://data.world/license-help).

visibility.description: Dataset visibility. `OPEN` if the dataset can be seen by any member of data.world. `PRIVATE` if the dataset can be seen by its owner and authorized collaborators.

files.description: Initial set of files. At dataset creation time, file uploads are not supported. However, this property can be used to add files via URL.

status.description:
Processing status of dataset.  This status can be checked periodically after changes are made to the dataset to determine the status of asynchronous processing.

* `NEW`: Just created. Not yet processed.
* `INPROGRESS`: Currently being processed.
* `LOADED`: Successfully processed.
* `SYSTEMERROR`: Error state due to processing failure.

created.description: Date and time when the dataset was created.

updated.description: Date and time when the dataset was last updated.

files.description: Updated set of files. When updating a set of files, file uploads are not supported. However, this property can be used to add files via URL or update metadata related to existing files.

name.description: File name. Should include type extension always when possible. Must not include slashes.

FileCreateOrUpdateRequest.title: File Create Or Update Request
FileCreateOrUpdateRequest.description: This model is utilized where sets of files can be specified to be added or updated (e.g. `PATCH:/dataset/{owner}` and `POST:/dataset/{owner}/{id}/files`).

name.description: File name. Should include type extension always when possible. Must not include slashes.

FileCreateRequest.title: File Create Request
FileCreateRequest.description: This model is utilized where sets of files can be specified only to be added (e.g. `POST:/dataset/{owner}`).

url.description: Source URL of file. Must be an http or https URL.

FileSourceCreateOrUpdateRequest.title: File Source Create Or Update Request
FileSourceCreateOrUpdateRequest.description: This model is utilized where source URLs can be specified for files to be added or updated.

url.description: Source URL of file. Must be an http or https URL.

FileSourceCreateRequest.title: File Create Request
FileSourceCreateRequest.description: This model is utilized where source URLs can be specified for files only to be added.

url.description: Source URL of file. Must be an http or https URL.

syncStatus.description:
Synchronization status of the file.  This status can be checked periodically after changes are made to the dataset to determine the status of asynchronous syncronization.

* `NEW`: Just created. Not yet synchronized.
* `INPROGRESS`: Currently being synchronized.
* `LOADED`: Successfully synchronized.
* `SYSTEMERROR`: Error state due to synchronization failure.

syncSummary.description: Human-readable message detailing status of last failed sync.

lastSyncStart.description: Date and time when synchronization last started.

lastSyncSuccess.description: Date and time when synchronization last finished successfully.

lastSyncFailure.description: Date and time when synchronization last failed.

name.description: File name. Should include type extension always when possible. Must not include slashes.

created.description: Date and time when file was created.

updated.description: Date and time when file was last updated.

created.description: Date and time when account was created.

updated.description: Date and time when account was last updated.

owner.name: owner
owner.description:
User name and unique identifier of the creator of the dataset.
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), jonloyens is the unique identifier of the dataset.

datasetId.name: id
datasetId.description:
Dataset unique identifier.  
For example, in the URL: [https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset](https://data.world/jonloyens/an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset), an-intro-to-dataworld-dataset is the unique identifier of the dataset.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum number of items to include in a page of results.

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
Property name to sort by.
Prefix with `+` for ascending order or with `-` for descending order. For example, `-created` will return items sorted by the `created` property in descending order.

next.name: next
next.description: Token from previous result page to be used when requesting a subsequent page.
